# UNIVERSEH EMI (English-Medium Instruction in Higher Education) Meet-up 3-- Space Technology Centre 

URL: https://ctk.agh.edu.pl/en/news/detail/universeh-emi-english-medium-instruction-in-higher-education-meet-up-3
Crawled: 2025-03-19 21:25:08

UNIVERSEH EMI (English-Medium Instruction in Higher Education) Meet-up 3 

 14-03-2025 

 Explore innovative approaches to English-Medium Instruction (EMI) in higher education through our UNIVERSEH EMI Special Interest Group, fostering collaboration, professional growth, and inclusivity in multilingual classrooms. 

In December, we had the pleasure of hosting Dr. Katrien Deroey (University of Luxembourg) for a talk on 
Designing EMI Lecturer Training Programmes: What and How?

We are delighted to invite you to our third meet-up, which will feature a two-part programme:

Pronunciation in English-Medium Education: Challenges, Realities and Communicative Impact – A Non-Native Speaker Perspective

Part I

This talk explores the role of pronunciation in EMI/EME, questioning its significance and examining what constitutes ‘good’ pronunciation in a multilingual classroom. Drawing on both existing research and insights from the speaker’s field study, we will discuss the challenges faced by teachers and students, their expectations, and the communicative impact of pronunciation. Rather than focusing on native-like standards, we will highlight what truly supports mutual understanding and effective engagement in diverse academic settings.

Part II

Following the talk, participants will have the opportunity to reflect on the findings and share their own experiences with pronunciation in English Medium Education and academic contexts.

Presenter and moderator: Anna Krukiewicz-Gacek, AGH University of Krakow

Date: 8 April 2025

Time: 12:30–14:00 CET

Location: Online (MS Teams)

Registration

Please register here by 7 April to join the meet-up:

https://forms.office.com/e/VQhhVtkzEh

About the UNIVERSEH EMI SIG

Do you want to join our group and...

Dive into the world of English Medium Instruction (EMI) in higher education with our new series of online meet-ups designed to support educators, administrators, and students in university settings.

Discover institutional support systems tailored for EMI teachers and administration, facilitating professional growth and development.

Explore innovative ways to adapt teaching styles, ensuring inclusivity and engagement for all students, regardless of the students’ discipline or language proficiency level.

Master the art of effective communication in multilingual classrooms, fostering a dynamic learning environment where diversity thrives.

Anna Krukiewicz-Gacek (AGH University of Krakow), UNIVERSEH EMI SIG Convenor, will be happy to assist you with any enquiries you may have - kruk@agh.edu.pl
